intro: Seseli filiforme, commonly known as slender seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Seseli filiforme typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
